title: Riot, your timing is impeccable!

embed.description: The PBE has been updated and the preseason madness continues! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers! Manage your expectations accordingly. ) !

body:
**Mordekaiser:**

Q; Both the first and second strike deal the same damage but the third deals upwards to 2 times of the damage.

->Actually a nerf, the total damage being changed from 260+390%AD+260%AP to 200+360%AD+240%AP
->Base damage nerf of 60, 0.2AP ratio and 0.3AD ratio nerf
->Evens out the damage of the three strikes, removing the flash Q3 combo and giving him more of a sustained thread.

W; Drain changed from 75-170 to 40-200.
Actually a net buff but a hit to his early sustain, especially bot lane.
->Decent change, I can get behind this one


And his siphon, oh boy!

Shield gain from champion hit buffed from 15% max shield strength from all ranks to 15-25 mother*cking percent.


Is this the real life?

Is this just fantasy?


Edit numero Uno;
These changes are actually a great starting point but Morde's reliance on hitting his three Q's makes him having actually decent AS, MS and base stats somewhat of a necessity.

Some suggestions;
AS per level: 2%->3%.  This would allow him to more effectively smack people with his mace late game, where every second matters

Health per level; 73->83  His base health is really, really bad. But I understand him needing to have less health than his fellow Juggernauts. This would beef up his bae health from 1765 to 1900ish. Seems decent actually :9

Base MS; 325 is really bad, especially with the other Juggernauts having 340+ and more CC, Mobility.
Giving him about 335 doesn't seem too much of a buff

Harvester of Sorrow...
Well....Any ETA on when we're going to get a functioning W solo?

EDIT: *These are not the changes anybody wants*. Q changes *are* in fact a huge nerf to Morde, and in particular they gut his AP burst builds (they just slashed the third hit Q ratio by 180% AP). It does buff the base damage notably (at rank 1 it deals 32 more, scaling up to 140 more base damage at rank 5), but it now scales mostly off of AD. This *may* entice more bruiserish builds from Morde, especially in tandem with the E buff (which would give him a *ton* of shield on cast if using a tank build).

I'm not sure if it made that build, but the AP ratio is going up to .6 from .2 on the base Q. This keeps the numbers essentially even as the AP Ratios on the swings are as follows
.6/.6/1.2 <-New
.2/(.4-.6)/(.8-1.8) <- Old (depends on ranks)

For a total Ap ratio of the following assuming you can land all 3 incremental hits. 
.6/1.2/2.4 <- New
.2/(.6-.8)/(1.4-2.6)  <- Old

The goal is to pull some of the Q3 power into the Q1 and streamline the numbers a bit, not substantially reduce his overall 3 hit damage output.
If you're going to nerf his Q damage, why not add power into his other skills? W is still weak in solo, and E just got a utility buff. What happened to buffing up his base stats too?
That buff on his E seems pretty huge to me, 10% more shield per enemy is some serious stuff.
It does seem pretty good, but still not great. Not until I see some base stat buffs, and his W being more useful alone, then I'll accept it :(

Literally all he needs after his Q being given more counterplay.

He's soo, sooo close from being good.
Just a little bit closer and we're all going to be happy.

I hope! O_o

Okay, i hate to break this to you, but I played Morde on PBE, and the tooltip and the values shown on surrender at 20 are flat out wrong.  The damage it's actually doing close to half of that. It's doing double the first OR second target target damage, not AND. Double damage, not quadruple. I don't know if the AP ratio is .4 or .8, but the AD ratio is clearly no more than 1.8 at ranked 5.

He's straight out nerfed; the AD ratio was reduced, not just the AP. It's double the first number, not some really high TAD scaling like it shows.  I think it's 100 - 180 TAD + .8 AP.

His q is very close to half of what it does on live, at least with a hybridish build. I was doing around 600 damage with the third q against minions with no MR, while the tooltip shows around 1100 damage, and live would do around 1200.

The 1st two hits doing the same damage is fine. Removing tonnes of AP scaling from the ability splits Morde in half. Which will make him WORSE by far.
